body.p: We the undersigned Citizens of the City of Louisville, State of Kentucky would most respectfully unite with Moses & Fanny Block in their petition to your Excellency to remit their fine imposed July 6th 1863; and would further state that the exercise of executive clemency towards them would be, as we believe proper and right.

L. Bamberger
Wm Kniephaber
M. Bach
Saml Lieberman
S. G. Henry & Co
T Anderson & Co
James L. Phelps
Wm Mix
L. Kahn
S. Ullman
H. Keisker
B. Hess
M H Richardson
Alex Owens

I have known Mr. M. Block for Eleven years, and during all that time he has born the reputation of a peace-loving, charitable gentleman. For a number of years he held offices of trust and honor in my Congregation, and has discharged them to his credit. Being his, as I confidently believe, his first error, I add willilngly my name to aid the petitioners.

Hughes P Pankhill
T R Levin & Comie
J P Buckner.
Prather, &, Smith
B. H. Gotthelf
Minister of the Jew. Congreg.
Nathan Bloom
Wm Skene
Edwd Fuller
John Christopher
F. H. Hegan
Owen Barkhouse & Co
L D, C, Hopkins
Hart & Co
Ivan Borries & Co
Jno Colemann
The fine of Fifty dollars agst Fanny Block is remitted. One half of the fine against her husband is remitted

J F Robinson
$100
$50 } Assault
Iss Aug 5. 1863
